guide.introduction: This experiment will involve making and then preserving crystals in space to study the effects of gravity on crystallization. For the purpose of this guide, silver crystals will be used but many other metals could be studied with this process. The crystals will be created by running an electric current through a silver salt using silver electrodes. The silver ions from the silver salt will be deposited on the cathode and will be replenished with new silver from the anode. Once sufficient crystals have grown and the launch vehicle begins to fall, the water containing the crystals will be frozen using dry ice to protect them. The same experiment is carried out in a lab and the crystals produced by both are compared.
